metadata.title: USN-6253-1 -- libvirt vulnerability
metadata.description: It wad discovered that libvirt incorrectly handled locking when processing certain requests. A local attacker could possibly use this issue to cause libvirt to stop responding or crash, resulting in a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6253-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libvirt-clients-qemu - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-dev - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-wireshark - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-login-shell - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libnss-libvirt - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-system - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-l10n - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-clients - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-config-network - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt0 - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-sanlock - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 libvirt-doc - 9.0.0-2ubuntu1.2 No subscription required
